reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed at the Park Tower from September 1-6, 2007. We seriously considered the boutique hotel in Palermo thing, but we decided that we wanted to splurge on this trip. Boy, are we glad that we chose the Park Tower. We liked the location, right next to Plaza San Martin and within walking distance of Recoleta, Calle Florida, Casa Rosada, and other big Buenos Aires draws. Otherwise, cab rides to farther reaches are really cheap-maybe $4 US to La Boca or Palermo. They had a room for us when we checked in at 9:30am on the 1st, which was a huge plus for us. We were on the 16th floor, and road noise was barely audible. I am a light sleeper and I didn't notice any noise at night. The bathroom was all marble, with 2 sinks, a tub and separate shower. The bed was good, but not the best hotel bed I've ever slept in. Not a negative-it was still good. Our room also had the desk and couch with a coffee table. There was a minibar as well. I've read that these standard rooms are among the largest of any hotel in Buenos Aires, so that is pretty good. Pretty much all of the staff were friendly and helpful, although one or two of the younger guys there were a bit aloof. Not a problem at all-still a good experience. The rate included a very good breakfast, which ran from 7-11am. There was also free access to the internet in the business center, which we took advantage of daily. Room service was a bit expensive, but we only did that once-just a sandwich. We highly recommend Las Nazarenas for steak, and it is across the street from the hotel. So overall, we had a great stay at the Park Tower, and we'd definitely stay there again.
reviews.title: Park Tower-Highly Recommended
Very Nice - But Check Your Bill
reviews.text: I spent three nights at the Park Tower and overall it was very nice with a few issues. First the good points: I arrived at 10:30 am after an all night flight from the USA and my room was ready. I was able to take a brief nap and recharge . That was a huge plus. The Staff was extremely polite and all seemed to speak English. The room was large and had a great view. The bathroom was also large with marble floors, a seperate shower, and a 110v outlet that was appreciated. The Lobby Lounge was great and they served complimentary snacks when you ordered a beverage.The location near Puerto Madero is great. Now for the not-so-good. The bed was mediocre and the pillows were hard and lumpy. The hotel restuarants were run-of-the- mill. The phone charges are outrageous: nearly $5 US just to access and outside line to make a calling card call. Imagine my shock on check out when I discovered a $15 charge from the Business Center, which I never visited, and a whopping $70 for a massage that I never had. The gracious staff, however, quickly rectified the errors and the Manager insisted I accept a beverage with his compliments for the error. I recommend the Park Tower but watch for those billing errors.

The hotel building itself is very elegant. It's got marble from floor to ceiling....but so do the ATMs in Buenos Aires. (Marble is very plentiful in Argentina and you'll find it everywhere.) There are tons of people around to help you all day. ex. one to open your cab door, one to open the door to the hotel, one to call the elevator, etc. This will leave your wallet much lighter if you tip all of them. The guy who brought breakfast to my room straight up asked for a tip, and not in a nice way either. It was 6a.m. I was bleary eyed, and hadn't even had the chance to sign the check before he was like, "Tip! Tip!" Before I left, I asked the front desk lady if tipping was mandatory and, if so, how much should I tip. She said that tipping was common only if you found the service exceptional, blah blah blah. Anyway, a friend of mine and I scheduled appointments to get manicures and pedicures. The service we got would be about what you'd get if you asked your best friend to paint your nails. I could have done a better job on myself. Totally not worth it. If you have time, though, the massage service is worth it...so is a visit to the steam room, sauna, and indoor pool. The only other problem I'd mention was that they never managed to send the maid when I was out of the room. Despite the fact that I was gone for half the day, I would come back, ready to sleep, and the maid would be in my room. I've been at other hotels with "butler" service where this NEVER happened. They take note of your coming and going and send the maid in accordingly.

reviews.text: This hotel prides itself on being elegant, but personally, we like our hotels a bit more modern. The lobby, as well as the rooms, seemed a little run down. The butler service is just a scam...they could just leave an iron in the room. The service was fine and the location is good....but for the same amount of money you can stay at a truly magnificent place like the Park Hyatt.

reviews.text: Our room was on the 18th floor overlooking the train station and river, beautiful view. Our butler polished our shoes and brought us Evian every night. Breakfast was included in our rate and was extraordinary, great omelette and medialunas with freshly squeezed orange juice and excellent coffee. Housekeeping did a wonderful job cleaning and tidying up the rooms. No WiFi in rooms but there is high speed internet at an extra fee (expensive but useful).

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Dining: Don't miss Piegari for great italian food, Bistro at Hotel Faena for modern fusion dining (very similar to trendy South Beach hotels and restaurants) and ice creams (Persicco and Fredo). Tried to dine at Sucre but were not able to get reservations. If you like hot chocolate, try a "submarino" (steamed milk with a melted chocolate bar inside). If you like very light coffee, try a "lagrima", a small cup of hot milk with a drop (or "tear") or coffee.

reviews.text: The location is very convenient to access the business district, Puerto Madeiro, Recoleta and the avenida Florida (all walking distance). The bus terminal Manuel Tienda Leon which takes you directly to the airport is just downstairs at the other side of the road.
Finally, I can also highly recommend the steakhouse Las Nazarenas just opposite the hotel - if offers high quality steaks and wine for very reasonable prices (by non Argentinan standards).

reviews.text: (2) When they finally came to fix it, the handy man LEFT MY FRONT DOOR OPEN. I had a $2,000 computer sitting out, a nice camera, an iPod, and numerous other valuable items. I returned to the room hours later to find the door wide open. Luckily, nothing was stolen. A call to the manager amounted only to them tightening the hinges on the door and a meaningless apology. No offer of a free meal, anything, for the fact that they left my valuables sitting open for anyone to take.
